Find occuring GRanges overlapping with the benchmarking set (positive + negative examples)

findOverlapsBench.Rd

Find occuring GRanges overlapping with the benchmarking set (positive + negative examples)

findOverlapsBench(occuring, benchmarking, predictor_col = "Sig",
  labels_col = "for_benchmarking", normalise = T,
  select_predictor_per_range = min, ...)

Arguments

occuring

GRanges object, occuring feature instances
benchmarking

GRanges object, feature instances for benchmarking
predictor_col

name of the metadata column in occuring that contains 1 - predictor value (such as p-value)
labels_col

name of the metadata column in benchmarking that contains labels for benchmarking (for, example 0 for negative and 1 for positive)
normalise

logical, normalise predictor value, just in case predictor doesn't span the full range between 0 ... 1
...

arguments such as maxgap, minoverlap passed to findOverlaps

Value

Genomic Ranges list object containing N randomised GRanges objects

See also

ELMdb2GRanges, GRangesINinteractionSubsetFASTA

  • Arguments
  • Value
